tags: but it is just my opinion
summary: Niko controls Eve? To me he seems just like the voice of reason. He's there to contrast how unhealthy her life choices are...
question: Niko controls Eve? To me he seems just like the voice of reason. He's there to contrast how unhealthy her life choices are slowly becoming.
answer:
he tries to. all this sense of protection is so fatherly at the point to become a kind of control. he is always being that wonderful husband that never is pissed of, that forgives the unforgivable just to make her feel guilty and unworthy of him, and this, imo is a way to control her. I don’t know if he does it intentionally, but he does.

like in ep 3. first he kissed her and when she tried to intensify the kiss, he stopped, he took her away from him and left her alone in the room. like… what the hell was that? was it to make eve think? because before it, he asked if she was leaving him and then said ironically “I know… you hate your new job, don’t you?”… like, he made her think that he was worried if she was leaving him, and then he kissed her and left her. *to me* at the least, it was a way of manipulation.

and still in ep 3, he didn’t remind her about that meet in their house with their friends, and when she asked why he didn’t remind her about it, he said that he didn’t want to stress her about her work. and when she said that they could reschedule, he said that it was in the calendar for months. like, in the last night instead of kiss her and left her alone in the room, he could just remind her about that meet. but for him it was easier to make her feel bad about it.

and still in ep 3, he didn’t remind her about that meet in their house with their friends, and when she asked why he didn’t remind her about it, he said that he didn’t want to stress her about her work. and when she said that they could reschedule, he said that it was in the calendar for months. like, in the last night instead of kiss her and left her alone in the room, he could just remind her about that meet. but for him it was easier to make her feel bad about it.

I don’t know if he does it intentionally, but he does.

like in ep 3. first he kissed her and when she tried to intensify the kiss, he stopped, he took her away from him and left her alone in the room. like… what the hell was that? was it to make eve think? because before it, he asked if she was leaving him and then said ironically “I know… you hate your new job, don’t you?”… like, he made her think that he was worried if she was leaving him, and then he kissed her and left her. *to me* at the least, it was a way of manipulation.

like in ep 3. first he kissed her and when she tried to intensify the kiss, he stopped, he took her away from him and left her alone in the room. like… what the hell was that? was it to make eve think? because before it, he asked if she was leaving him and then said ironically “I know… you hate your new job, don’t you?”… like, he made her think that he was worried if she was leaving him, and then he kissed her and left her. *to me* at the least, it was a way of manipulation.

thanks for coming to my ted talk
summary: I see some people victimizing niko and saying eve is an awful wife. Saying she's abusive with him, saying he doesn't deserve...
body: I see some people victimizing niko and saying eve is an awful wife. Saying she’s abusive with him, saying he doesn’t deserve “all this shit”, but what y'all think about considering all these years that eve spent making of herself a little smaller just to suit in niko’s world? What about start to consider all these years saying no to all she wanted to be and do, just to be able do be his perfect wife? What about stop saying she’s abusive when the only one who pretends to support their partner with their job, chooses and life, just to make their partner feel guilty about their job, chooses and life after is him? If y'all started to pay a little more of attention on their relationship you will see that the manipulative and controller in this relationship isn’t eve. I’m not saying eve is innocent here. She made a lot of mistakes, she did hide a lot of things from him, but if there is an abusive person in this relationship, isn’t her.

If y'all started to pay a little more of attention on their relationship you will see that the manipulative and controller in this relationship isn’t eve. I’m not saying eve is innocent here. I THINK ABOUT YOU ALL THE TIME // a villaneve playlist

Me? Back on my bullshit? It’s more likely than you think.
